solutions.code:
# In Render dashboard:
# Build Command: npm install && npm run build
# Start Command: npm start

# Set in Environment:
NODE_VERSION=18

# render.yaml:
buildCommand: apt-get update && apt-get install -y build-essential && npm install

# View logs in Render dashboard
# Events tab shows deploy history

# Service Settings > Health Check Path
# Set to your health endpoint: /health

services:
  - type: web
    name: my-app
    env: node
    buildCommand: npm install && npm run build
    startCommand: npm start
    healthCheckPath: /health

# Service > Environment > Add Environment Variable
# Key: API_KEY, Value: your-value

# Upload .env file in Environment section
# Or use Secret Files

services:
  - type: web
    name: my-app
    envVars:
      - key: API_KEY
        sync: false  # Manual entry required

# New > PostgreSQL
# Copy Internal Database URL to service env

# In render.yaml:
databases:
  - name: mydb
    databaseName: mydb
    user: myuser

services:
  - type: web
    envVars:
      - key: DATABASE_URL
        fromDatabase:
          name: mydb
          property: connectionString

# Add DATABASE_URL as environment variable
# pointing to external database

const port = process.env.PORT || 10000;
app.listen(port);

import os
port = int(os.environ.get('PORT', 10000))
app.run(host='0.0.0.0', port=port)

# Render uses PORT=10000 by default
# Your app must bind to this port
